step1.sentence: Instead of scrolling through social media for an hour, she decided to use her time wisely and finish the report before dinner.

step2.story: Mark had only two hours before his evening class, and his roommate suggested he use his time wisely by reviewing the lecture notes first. He made a quick plan, tackled the most important tasks, and arrived at class feeling genuinely prepared.

step3.story: On the last day of her vacation, Priya sat by the window with a cup of coffee and thought about the week ahead. Her manager had always told her to use her time wisely, and for once she truly understood what that meant. She opened her notebook and wrote down three priorities she wanted to accomplish before Friday. Instead of reacting to every notification, she blocked out deep-work hours and protected them like appointments. By Thursday afternoon she had cleared her backlog and even found time to mentor a junior colleague. Looking back, that one decision to use her time wisely had made the entire week feel purposeful.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 자신에게 주어진 시간을 현명하고 효율적인 방식으로 활용하다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 주어진 시간을 낭비하지 않고 중요한 일에 집중하라고 조언하거나 스스로 다짐할 때 사용한다. 학업, 업무, 일상 계획 등 다양한 맥락에서 쓰인다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'wise'는 고대 영어 'wīs'(현명한, 지식 있는)에서 유래했으며, 부사 'wisely'는 단순히 '잘'이 아니라 '판단력을 갖추고'라는 뜻을 내포한다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 단순히 빠르게 일하라는 뜻이 아니라 우선순위를 파악하고 의미 있게 시간을 쓰라는 뉘앙스가 강하다. 자기계발이나 멘토링 상황에서 자주 등장하며 다소 격식체 조언처럼 들릴 수 있다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: You only have thirty minutes before the meeting, so use your time wisely.
